text: The Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the twelfth edition of the Junior Eurovision Song Contest. It took place at the Malta Shipbuilding, Marsa, Malta on 15 November 2014, Maltese broadcaster PBS was the host broadcaster for the event. The motto for the contest was "#Together". ==Results== Draw Country Artist Song Language Place Points 01 Nadezhda Misyakova "Sokal" () Belarusian 7 71 02 Krisia, Hasan & Ibrahim "Planet of the Children" Bulgarian 2 147 03 The Peppermints "Breaking My Heart" Italian, English 15 21 04 Josie "Game Over" Croatian, English 16 13 05 Sophia Patsalides "I pio omorfi mera" () Greek, English 9 69 06 Lizi Pop "Happy Day" Georgian, English 11 54 07 Julia Kedhammar "Du är inte ensam" Swedish, English 13 28 08 Sympho-Nick "Spring Will Come" Ukrainian, English 6 74 09 Ula Ložar "Nisi sam (Your Light)" Slovene, English 12 29 10 Maša Vujadinović & Lejla Vulić "Budi dijete na jedan dan" Montenegrin, English 14 24 11 Vincenzo Cantiello "Tu primo grande amore" Italian, English 1 159 12 Betty "People of the Sun" Armenian, English 3 146 13 Alisa Kozhikina "Dreamer" Russian, English 5 96 14 Emilija Đonin "Svet u mojim očima" () Serbian 10 61 15 Federica Falzon "Diamonds" English 4 116 16 Julia van Bergen "Around" Dutch, English 8 70 ==Score sheet== Voting procedure used: Results Belarus 71 8 1 3 2 1 6 5 6 2 1 3 8 6 7 Bulgaria 147 4 7 12 12 8 10 8 10 8 10 7 7 12 8 12 San Marino 21 8 1 Croatia 13 1 Cyprus 69 6 3 8 8 4 6 4 4 5 3 6 Georgia 54 1 4 2 2 1 3 2 12 5 1 7 2 Sweden 28 2 1 3 4 1 5 Ukraine 74 6 4 7 4 7 1 10 3 4 4 5 4 3 Slovenia 29 1 3 2 3 2 2 4 Montenegro 24 3 4 5 Italy 159 12 2 10 12 10 10 10 7 10 12 12 8 6 8 10 8 Armenia 146 7 12 12 7 6 6 12 8 12 8 2 2 12 6 12 10 Russia 96 5 10 7 5 5 8 3 1 5 7 5 10 10 3 Serbia 61 3 6 6 8 3 4 5 7 6 1 Malta 116 10 8 5 10 7 5 4 7 6 6 12 6 10 7 1 Netherlands 70 2 5 3 4 4 5 2 12 1 1 7 5 2 3 2 All countries automatically receive 12 points === 12 points === N. Contestant Voting nation 6 Armenia Belarus, Bulgaria, Georgia, Malta, Russia, Ukraine 4 Bulgaria Croatia, Cyprus, Netherlands, Serbia Italy Kids' jury, Montenegro, San Marino, Slovenia 1 Georgia Armenia Malta Italy Netherlands Sweden * All countries were given 12 points at the start of voting. This was so no country got nul points. ===Commentators=== Most countries sent commentators to Malta, while others commentated from their own country ====Countries that took part in the content ==== * – Avet Barseghyan (Armenia 1) * – Anatoliy Lipetskiy (Belarus 1 and Belarus 24) * – Georgy Kushvaliev and Elena Rosberg (BNT 1 and BNT HD) * – Ivan Planinić and Aljoša Šerić (HRT 2) * – Kyriacos Pastides (CyBC 2 and CyBC HD) * – Mero Chikashvili & Temo Kvirkvelia (GPB 1TV) * – Simone Lijoi and Antonella Clerici (Rai Gulp) * – Daniel Chircop (TVM) * – Dražen Bauković & Tamara Ivanković (TVCG 2) * – Jan Smit (NPO 3) * – Olga Shelest and Alexander Gurevich (Karousel) * – Lia Fiorio and Gilberto Gattei (SMRTV) * – Silvana Grujić (RTS 2) * – Bernarda Žarn (TV SLO 1) * – Edward af Sillén and Ylva Hällen (SVT Barnkanalen) * – Timur Miroshnychenko (Pershyi Natsionalnyi) ====Countries that didn't take part in the content==== * – Victor Barrera (Radio WU) * – Georgia McCarthy and Andre Nookadu (SBS2) * – Ewan Spence (92.5 Phoenix FM) * – Ewan Spence (World FM) * – Ewan Spence (247 Music Radio) * – Ewan Spence (103 The Eye, K107, Oystermouth Radio, Radio Six International and Shore Radio) * – Ewan Spence (KCGW (Williams Life Radio); and WXDR (Delgado’s Dolphin Radio)) ==References== == Other websites == * Category:2014 in Europe Category:2014 in music Category:Malta Category:Junior Eurovision Song Contest by year Category:November 2014 events
